search_parameters.q: what is an avm in colon?

search_information.query_displayed: what is an avm in colon?

related_questions.question: What causes AVM in the colon?
related_questions.snippet: Most likely, the problem develops due to normal movement of the colon that causes the blood vessels in the area to enlarge. When this swelling becomes severe, a tiny passageway develops between a small artery and vein. This is called an arteriovenous malformation.
related_questions.title: Angiodysplasia of the colon Information - Mount Sinai

related_questions.question: How serious is an AVM?
related_questions.snippet: Because the tangled blood vessels in an AVM do not form properly, they can weaken and burst. If an AVM in the brain bursts, it can cause bleeding in the brain, which can lead to a stroke or brain damage. Bleeding in the brain is known as a hemorrhage. Read more about brain AVM (arteriovenous malformation).
related_questions.title: Arteriovenous malformation - Symptoms and causes

related_questions.question: What is the life expectancy of someone who has an AVM?
related_questions.snippet: An AVM can slightly decrease life expectancy. But, by and large, you can expect to return to a normal life and have a normal life expectancy if your AVM is cured by complete surgical removal.
related_questions.title: Brain Arteriovenous Malformation (AVM) - Diagnosis and Treatment

related_questions.question: What does AVM mean in gastroenterology?
related_questions.snippet: Gastric arteriovenous malformation (AVM) is an uncommon cause of upper gastrointestinal bleeding. However, it can be fatal and almost always requires surgical treatment. The endoscopic findings of gastric AVM are unclear and have only rarely been reported (1).
related_questions.title: Gastric Arteriovenous Malformation with Characteristic Endoscopic ...
